revised_title: Density Matrices for Atoms and Solids: Effective Potential Matrix and the Bloch Equation
tldr: This article presents a powerful approximate solution to the Bloch equation by introducing the effective potential matrix, which is closely related to the potential in which particles move. The method allows for non-perturbative calculations of the density matrix and can be used for Hartree self-consistent field calculations on atoms and defect solids.
